intro: Clidemia farinasii, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in rainforests. Clidemia farinasii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing nectar for various pollinators.
